H0.text: The oldest known American cocktail, what whiskey forms the base of the cocktail known as a Sazerac. Bourbon

H1.text: The oldest known American cocktail, what whiskey forms the base of the cocktail known as a Sazerac. Tennessee Whiskey

H2.text: The oldest known American cocktail, what whiskey forms the base of the cocktail known as a Sazerac. Scotch

H3.text: The oldest known American cocktail, what whiskey forms the base of the cocktail known as a Sazerac. Rye

A4.text: It is around this time that the primary ingredient changed from cognac to rye whiskey, due to the phylloxera epidemic in Europe that devastated the vineyards of France.

A5.text: The drink is most traditionally a combination of cognac or rye whiskey, absinthe, Peychaud's Bitters, and sugar, although bourbon whiskey is sometimes substituted for the rye.
